page.title: 07LOSS OF VILLAGE AMENITIES
page.content: In recent years the village of Alkham has lost many local amenities, a once thriving community has become a picturesque dormitory for Folkestone and Dover. The village school has closed, junior children now travel to Capel. One of the two village public houses has shut down. The local vicar has moved to Capel because the sprawling vicarage was uneconomic to run. The local Squire has died, his mansion is now only a weekend home for his sons. Bus services have been slashed and the local shop and post office have been closed, with only a temporary post office service provided in the Village Hall. Extra work for villagers was lost when farming expansion was banned and planners have refused new building schemes which would have increased the population and consequent support of amenities.
